Global Learning Course: Monuments, Memorials, and Meanings in the US South and Japan. Course is by application, due by Oct. 17th. Overview: 2020 marked the 75th anniversary of the bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki. Building on this commemorative occasion, our course engages the legacies of war and catastrophic loss through an analysis of the visual culture, or "ways of seeing," linked to monuments, memorials, and sites of memory in the U.S. and postwar Japan, culminating in travel to Tokyo, Kyoto, Osaka, Hiroshima, and Nagasaki in May. (Course may also include a day trip to Montgomery, Alabama during the semester.)
Japan travel dates: May 10th - May 25th, 2022.
course_description: History of the use of visual images in Western culture. Study of tools necessary to read images, including still and moving images, performance, and display.
prerequisites: ENG_OX 185 or ENG_OX 186 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
